column4: what are you trying to achieve and are you using binary video drivers and the nvidia-settings app ?
connects via what kind of connection ?
I want to set my resolution from 640x480 to 1360x768 (max supported) (it was working great on 9.10). I'm using the proprietary nvidia drivers and I'm using nvidia-setting
what do you mean by kind of connection? like VGA?
yes dbus cable, dvi cable hdmi cable etc
VGA cable.
first thing i would check is if it worked fine with 9.10 is what has changed.. (i assume the binary drivers you were using are not yet tuned properly for the changes that 10.04 brings)
where did you install the nvidia drivers from ?
using ubuntu software to install the recommended driver.
actually I had a friend here back when I was using 9.10 who changed my xorg.conf to something my monitor recognized great using nvdia drivers.
but since i forgot to backup that xorg.conf, i'm trying to figure what are the changes needed to be done by my own
there is a thread somewhere on ubuntu forums about detecting monitors and setting modelines etc etc for nvidia, under tutorials and tips (it might be a few years old but the concepts still apply)
any reason why you're not using the vadpu drivers from the ppa ?
I don't know. Ubuntu just popped "you may need to install some proprietary drivers for you graphics cards." and then I selected the recommended one and that was it.
in the nvidia settings gui what version does it say the drivers are ?
labeled : Server Vendor Version:
and the one labeled :  NVIDIA Driver Version:
ok yours is newer than mine :(
i suggest you hunt down any nvidia type guides on the ubuntu forums in the tutorial and tips section
hahah who said that newer is better? i cant even change from 640x480
going to do that, thanks for your time anyway :)
